subject: Critical Thinking
title: Character vs. Rules: What Kind of Person Should I Be?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Character vs. Rules: What Kind of Person Should I Be? usable.

hook.text: Rules tell you: don't lie. Virtue ethics asks a deeper question: what kind of person do you want to be?

buildup.text: Virtue ethics shifts focus from 'What should I do?' to 'What kind of person should I be?' Character is primary.

discovery.text: An honest person tells the truth not because a rule says to, but because dishonesty is incompatible with who they are.

twist.text: The critique: virtue ethics is vague. 'Be virtuous' doesn't tell you what to do in a specific dilemma.

climax.text: The defense: no ethical system gives specific answers to every case.

punchline.text: Rules are for beginners. Character is for life.

quiz.question: What is the central question of virtue ethics?
options: What kind of person should I be?
